programmes.show_description: It's Christmas Eve and six lonely people are looking to grab an elusive slice of enjoyment. Who better to contact than an escort agency. Contains sex scenes and distressing scenes.
Comedy. The story of Great Train Robber Buster Edwards, a small-timer who fell in with more ambitious thieves. Phil Collins and Julie Walters star.
The frank story of eight people's tempestuous relationship with alcohol - from first drink to rock bottom, we see what it took to get sober and build a new life in recovery.

Ronnie Barker stars as General Futtock, who has a motley group of guests stay at his country estate - and chaos ensues. Contains 70s social attitudes.
Comedy. Norman Wisdom stars as a bank manager who upends his square existence to join some youthful hippies. Will this new groovy energy bring the spark back to his marriage?
1/2. The epic story of Libyan leader Omar Mukhtar resisting Italian occupation in the 1930s. Can guerrillas beat Italian military might? Anthony Quinn and Ollie Reed star.
2/2. The epic tale of Libyan leader Omar Mukhtar concludes with relentless resistance to Italian conquest - through sacrifice and bloodshed. Anthony Quinn and Ollie Reed star.
Spy thriller. Promising Oxford University students are disappearing. An M15 investigation uncovers a pattern of accidents and arrests. Is the KGB involved? Terence Stamp stars.
Action. Pierce Brosnan plays a UN espionage expert who leads an elite team to recover a stolen Rembrandt masterpiece in this action sequel based on Alistair MacLean's novel.
Gordon Laid is a soldier returning to London after WW2. He gets mixed up in a series of murders and mistaken identities. Bawdy romp with Robin Askwith. Contains nudity and 70s social attitudes.
Hapless Jon Pigeon works in a sex research institute. To seduce a colleague, he invents an aphrodisiac-emitter machine turning any man or woman into a horny fiend. Contains nudity.
Solomon Watkins' quirky take as he interviews Michael, owner of the world's most unique collection of Really Thick Glasses. Funded and supported by Together TV and Cat Flap Media.

10/35. Chris and Lee are in Runcorn to transform Craig and Craig's empty new-build plot. One Craig wants a clean, stylish design, and the other wants to bring in the wildlife.
Archaeologists Alex and Peter and historian Ruth try Edwardian life for a year. The team get to grips with the revolutionary technologies of the age.
6/15. In Wales, Rick meets the farmer dodging old WWII bombs to raise salt marsh lamb, goes night-fishing on the River Tywi and demonstrates how to smoke sea trout.
4/9. Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to Chessington to create a car themed garden with some of the most inventive features they've ever created in the series.
15/20. An antiques expert, a market trader and an upcycler compete to make the most money. Gavin Claxton, Melissa Downhill and Zoe Pocock visit Chipping Campden.
DIY expert Dave Wellman visits a couple in Southampton, who have an unfinished bathroom and building site for a home. 1/20
Dave Wellman who demonstrates how to create more space in a boxroom and make it into a into a proper bedroom. 2/10
1/8. How much will the collectors and dealers bid for a Banksy artwork, pickled pig foetuses and Tommy Cooper's fez?
4/8. In Surrey, Linda and Mark need an upgrade on their cramped floating home and Linda's doing it by herself. Is passion enough to get the job done?
Abigail Gorman is a well-known activist and campaigner; we follow her through an ADHD diagnosis and ask what the future might hold.
Tom Gaisford's film follows a gay trans man stepping into the ring for a boxing fight. This knockout documentary gives you a ringside seat to a situation gaining notoriety.
4/9. Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to Chessington to create a car themed garden with some of the most inventive features they've ever created in the series.
2/8. Stefan examines the differing conditions under which hens lay eggs. Sian asks how effective at probiotic drinks really are. Own-brand cereals vs. the best-known brands.
Hermon and Heroda are back playing cupid, as eight hopeful singles take on three rounds of playful dating games in the hope of finding a match.
Shiva Raichandani's film follows Asifa as she prepares to undergo gender affirmation surgery. The trans activist reflects on how her life has changed during her transition
Portrait artist Alan Street is employed by the Soho Swingers Club to paint the hostesses. Whilst he relishes his new job his girlfriend is less than impressed. Contains nudity.
